questions: Calculate the net force acting on a bus boarded with passenger, of mass 2000 kg moving with a uniform velocity of 60 km/hr.
answers: Since velocity is uniform, acceleration will be zero therefore net force is zero.   1

questions: If a balloon filled with air and its mouth untied, the air is released from its mouth in the downward direction, and balloon moves upwards. Identify action and reaction in this case.  1 Mark each
answers: Release of air in downward direction is action. Movement of balloon in upward direction is reaction.  1

questions: In a tug of war, the rope does not move in any direction. Why ?
answers: Because the forces applied by the two teams are equal and opposite.  1

questions: Name the force which is responsible for change in position or state of an object.
Rakesh tries to push a box on a rough floor but is unable to move it. Name the force which balances the force applied by him.
Given below are some measuring units of different physical quantities :
answers: Water is ejected from a hose with a large amount of force . Hence as per Newton’s III law there will be an equal and opposite force on the hose pipe making it difficult to hold.

questions: Give one point of difference between balanced and unbalanced forces.
answers: When forces acting on a body from all sides are equal, they cancel effect of each other and are known as balanced forces. On the other hand, when forces acting on a body are not equal/do not cancel each other are called unbalanced forces. 1

questions: Why does the sole of the shoe wears out ?
answers: Sole of the shoe wears out due to friction between sole of the shoes and earth’s surface.

questions: State the meaning of recoil velocity of a gun ?
answers: Force of friction.  1 kg - ms-2, ms-2, kg - ms-1, ms-1, kg - m2 s-2. Select the units which measure force and momentum respectively.

questions: Why are the athletes in a high jump event made to fall either on a cushioned bed or on a sand bed ?
answers: To reduce the rate of change of momentum and hence the force.  1

questions: During the game of table tennis, if the ball hits a player it does not hurt him. On the other hand when a fast moving cricket ball hits a spectator it may hurt him. State the reason.
answers: Changing in speed/change of direction/change of shape.  1

questions: State two effects, a force can produce in a non rigid body fixed at a position.
State an example, how force can change velocity of a body.
answers: The momentum of a cricket ball is larger than a table tennis ball so it hurts the spectator.

questions: Velocity-time graph of a moving particle of mass 1 kg is shown in figure. Vel ocit y
Mention any two kinds of changes that can be brought about in a body by force.
answers: Acceleration = 0, F = ma. So, F = 0, force acting is zero.  1

questions: A force is applied on a metal block lying on floor in one direction. Still the block does not move. Name the force which is balancing it.
answers: Force of friction between metal surface and floor.  1

questions: Find the acceleration produced by a force of 12 N exerted on an object of mass 3 kg.
What is the net momentum of gun and bullet system after firing ?
answers: The momentum of gun and bullet system after firing is equal to initial momentum, i.e., zero, because no external force is acting.

questions: A body accelerates when balanced force acts on it. Is it true or false ? Why ?
answers: It is false because momentum of a body changes only when, an unbalanced force acts on it.
